elements.title: D. M. Clemson
elements.contents: ... that the freighter D. M. Clemson (pictured) was one of the largest vessels on the Great Lakes in 1903?

elements.title: Miriam Defensor Santiago
elements.contents: ... that Filipino politician Miriam Defensor Santiago is known as the "Iron Lady of Asia"?

elements.title: a 16th-century ethnic term used in Africa
elements.contents: ... that a 16th-century ethnic term used in Africa is still used today for a Brazilian religion, a Togolese and Beninese ethnic group, and their language?

elements.title: Raghunath Brahmbhatt
elements.contents: ... that it took 40 years for Raghunath Brahmbhatt to be credited for the lyrics to a popular song he wrote, 21 years after his death?

elements.title: My Family Member
elements.contents: ... that My Dad, the first entry in My Family Member, a series of illustrated children books, was inspired by the author's discovery of his father's old gown?

elements.title: John Adams Cameron
elements.contents: ... that John Adams Cameron lost twice to John Culpepper in elections for the United States Congress that were 14 years apart?

elements.title: Way of the Warrior
elements.contents: ... that neighbors thought Naughty Dog was filming adult films due to their setup of shooting moves for Way of the Warrior from an apartment hallway?

elements.title: Mia Lee
elements.contents: ... that painter and designer Mia Lee used to make doll fashions from her grandmother's scraps?

elements.title: Hogan's golf clubs
elements.contents: ... that Jack Fleck defeated Ben Hogan in a playoff to win the 1955 U.S. Open using Hogan's golf clubs?
